channel.title: Cache finding
channel.description:
... I keep getting this error THIS BATCH IS FOR DEBUGGING THE EXECUTABLE JAR ONLY DOUBLE-CLICK THE "lopkoikok.jar" TO RUN IT - Generated by: JAR Maker (http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/)
C:\Users\Kyle\Desktop\JAR Maker>java -jar lopkoikok.jar java.io.FileNotFoundException: .\cache\Sprites.dat (The system cannot find the f ile specified) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(Native Method) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(RandomAccessFile.java:233) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(RandomAccessFile.java:118) at CustomSprites.loadCustomSprites(CustomSprites.java:11) at Gui.<init>(Gui.java:115) at Gui.main(Gui.java:39)
The file is there, i dont know whats wrong e_e

item.title: Cache finding
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

.\cache\Sprites.dat

That depends on the relative location, so the directory is probably wrong…

Read full topic

item.title: Cache finding
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

… Oh I never new the location of the jar made a difference =p

Read full topic

item.title: Cache finding
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“ravekitty, post:3, topic:438389”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=541107.msg3963378#msg3963378 date=1333488693]

… I keep getting this error THIS BATCH IS FOR DEBUGGING THE EXECUTABLE JAR ONLY
DOUBLE-CLICK THE “lopkoikok.jar” TO RUN IT

Generated by: JAR Maker (http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/)

C:\Users\Kyle\Desktop\JAR Maker>java -jar lopkoikok.jar
java.io.FileNotFoundException: .\cache\Sprites.dat (The system cannot find the f
ile specified)
at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(Native Method)
at java.io.RandomAccessFile.(RandomAccessFile.java:233)
at java.io.RandomAccessFile.(RandomAccessFile.java:118)
at CustomSprites.loadCustomSprites(CustomSprites.java:11)
at Gui.(Gui.java:115)
at Gui.main(Gui.java:39)

The file is there, i dont know whats wrong e_e

Upload a picture of your folder… Including the jar
[/quote]
sorry, Do you mean the folder its trying to get the sprites from , or the folder where the jar is… ._.[/quote]

Both. From what the code says, the map should look similar to this:
Main folder
-Jar
–Cache
—Sprites
----Sprites.dat

Read full topic
